solution_line_template: On Monday, she spends {monday_poodles} poodles * {hours_per_poodle} hours = <<{monday_poodles}*{hours_per_poodle}={monday_poodle_hours}>>{monday_poodle_hours} hours walking poodles.

On Monday, she spends {monday_chihuahuas} Chihuahuas * {hours_per_chihuahua} hour = <<{monday_chihuahuas}*{hours_per_chihuahua}={monday_chihuahua_hours}>>{monday_chihuahua_hours} hours walking Chihuahuas.

On Tuesday, she spends {tuesday_chihuahuas} Chihuahuas * {hours_per_chihuahua} hour = <<{tuesday_chihuahuas}*{hours_per_chihuahua}={tuesday_chihuahua_hours}>>{tuesday_chihuahua_hours} hours walking Chihuahuas.

On Wednesday, she spends {wednesday_labradors} Labradors * {hours_per_labrador} hours = <<{wednesday_labradors}*{hours_per_labrador}={wednesday_labrador_hours}>>{wednesday_labrador_hours} hours walking Labradors.

Over the week, this is a total of {monday_poodle_hours} + {monday_chihuahua_hours} + {tuesday_chihuahua_hours} + {wednesday_labrador_hours} = <<{monday_poodle_hours}+{monday_chihuahua_hours}+{tuesday_chihuahua_hours}+{wednesday_labrador_hours}={total_hours_spent}>>{total_hours_spent} hours spent dog-walking.

This means she still has {total_available_hours} maximum hours - {total_hours_spent} used hours = <<{total_available_hours}-{total_hours_spent}={remaining_hours}>>{remaining_hours} hours available for dog-walking.
Therefore, she can walk {remaining_hours} hours / {hours_per_poodle} hours per poodle = <<{remaining_hours}/{hours_per_poodle}={poodles_on_tuesday}>>{poodles_on_tuesday} poodles on Tuesday.
